meanings.definition: To cause (a cell) to undergo plasmolysis.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will plasmolyse the cell to study its structure.
meanings.sent2: If you plasmolyse the plant cell, it will shrink due to water loss.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally plasmolysed the cell in the experiment, oops!
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words seemed to plasmolyse his heart, leaving it empty.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat caused the ice sculpture to plasmolyse into a puddle.

meanings.sent1: During plasmolyse, the cell membrane shrinks away from the cell wall.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of plasmolyse in biology class.
meanings.sent3: The plasmolyse of the plant cell was like watching a slow-motion collapse.
meanings.sent4: The plasmolyse of the balloon as it deflated was oddly satisfying to watch.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the beauty of plasmolyse in their abstract painting.
